question: Which one of the following States of India does not have a Legislative Council so far even though the Constitution (Seventh Amendment) Act, 1956 provides for it?
explanation: As of today, six states have Legislative Councils. These are  Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. Andhra Pradesh had a Legislative Council from 1958, abolished it in 1985, and reconstituted it in 2007.
